# Superpermutation
Superpermutation fastest

The fastest theoretically possible way to obtain a superpermutation of length N.
This won't be the shortest superpermutation starting with n > 5, but it is a very efficient way to obtain such sequences. \
1 = A \
2 = ABA \
3 = ABCABACBA \
4&nbsp;=&nbsp;ABCDABCADBCABDCABACDBACBDACBADCBA \
5&nbsp;=&nbsp;ABCDEABCDAEBCDABECDABCEDABCADEBCADBECADBCEADBCAEDBCABDECABDCEABDCAEBDCABEDCABACDEBACDBEACDBAECDBACEDBACBDEACBDAECBDACEBDACBEDACBADECBADCEBADCBEADCBAEDCBA \
6&nbsp;=&nbsp; \
...
$$Length = \sum_{i=1}^{n} i\!$$

|  n  |   length  |
|-----|-----------|
|   1 |         1 |
|   2 |         3 |
|   3 |         9 |
|   4 |        33 |
|   5 |       153 |
|   6 |       873 |
|   7 |      5913 |
|   8 |     46233 |
|   9 |    409113 |
|  10 |   4037913 |
|  11 |  43954713 |
|  12 | 522956313 |
